snippet: The Obama administration, seeing signs of Chinese frustration toward Pyongyang, is pressing China to crack down or face more of an American military presence in Asia.
abstract: Obama administration is pressuring new Chinese Pres Xi Jinping to crack down on regime in North Korea, or face heightened American military presence in region; officials brief China in detail concerning American plans to upgrade missile defenses and other steps to deter increasingly belligerent threats from Kim Jong-un; move plays on surprising shift in decades of Chinese support for North.

byline.contributor: Jane Perlez contributed reporting from Beijing, and Neil MacFarquhar from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: The Obama administration, seeing signs of Chinese frustration toward Pyongyang, is pressing China to crack down or face more of an American military presence in Asia.

headline.main: Detecting Shift, U.S. Makes Case to China on North Korea
headline.print_headline: U.S. Sees China as Lever to Press North Korea
